description: This biology course emphasizes learning strategies and critical thinking skills as applied to the
curriculum of Biology 125.  Objectives of the course are met through additional readings, problem
sets, brief written assignments, introduction of discipline specific writing styles, projects
(including individual and/or group oral presentation), and library research.  Assignments include
new content that complements introductory biology.  Offered annually.  Prerequisites:
concurrent enrollment in Biology 125 and permission of instructor.
